metadata.synopsis: Origing Moment with Godey, lackey of Cazador.Astarion hates him.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl + Shift + 7)Astarion - Recruit as Companion or AvatarAstarion - Origin Moments - KennelMove in the direction the characters are facing

24.speaker: Godey
24.text: So so, you've come home, little one. And come to visit Godey in your old kennel.
24.context: NodeContext: Growly or through gritted teeth

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: It's taking everything I have not to grind your rotten carcass to dust.
55.context: NodeContext: Growly or through gritted teeth

21.speaker: Godey
21.text: Don't be mad at Godey, child. I only did my job. Only kept you in line.
21.context: NodeContext: Growly or through gritted teeth

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: You tortured us. For days at a time.
4.context: NodeContext: Growly or through gritted teeth

8.speaker: Godey
8.text: Oh yes, and you sang so sweetly for me. None of the others screamed like you did.
8.context: NodeContext: reluctantly calling Cazador 'the master' to try and trick Godey into giving you the key

59.speaker: Godey
59.text: But if you're not here to see Godey, why are you here, little one?
59.context: NodeContext: reluctantly calling Cazador 'the master' to try and trick Godey into giving you the key

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: We're here to see the master, but the ballroom door's locked. Give us the key.
42.context: NodeContext: reluctantly calling Cazador 'the master' to try and trick Godey into giving you the key

17.speaker: Godey
17.text: Hah! No no, it is too late. The doors are sealed on master's orders.

45.speaker: Godey
45.text: Godey will not open them for anyone, much less for you.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: I was hoping you'd say that. Taking it from the ruins of your corpse will be more satisfying anyway.

53.speaker: Godey
53.text: You can try, little one, but you will fail.

26.speaker: Godey
26.text: Now, let's hear that scream of yours one last time.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: Isn't it obvious? I'm going to kill Cazador.

46.speaker: Godey
46.text: How dare you! As if you could lay a finger on the master, you ungrateful little brat!

30.speaker: Godey
30.text: Godey will not let you get away with blasphemy. Godey will see you punished!

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *The familiar stink of the cell fills your nostrils and memories flood back. You remember spending days, tendays, locked down here in 'the Kennel', suffering endless tortures.*
57.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *This playground belonged to Godey - a skeleton sadistic enough that Cazador left him in charge of 'discipling' you and the other vampire spawn.*
44.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

65.speaker: Godey
65.text: Remembering the good times, little one?
65.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

67.speaker: Godey
67.text: Remembering how you'd sing for Godey? Oh, but I have missed your screams.

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *The very same skeleton you catch trying to sneak up on you now.*
73.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

6.speaker: Godey
6.text: You always were sharp, little one. Sharp enough to cut yourself.
6.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

56.speaker: Godey
56.text: What are you doing here? Did you miss me as I've missed you?
56.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: I've come home to rejoin the family.
51.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

75.speaker: Godey
75.text: But you're too late, the master entered the ballroom and had me seal the doors behind him. They will not to be opened until his business is done.

33.speaker: Godey
33.text: But you're too late, the master entered the ballroom and had me seal the doors behind him. They will not to be opened until his business is done.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: He needs me to complete the ritual. He'll be furious if you stop me from joining him.

39.speaker: Godey
39.text: Perhaps. You did come home... Yes, you can be trusted. It is a family key, after all.

68.speaker: Godey
68.text: Perhaps. You did come home... Yes, you can be trusted. It is a family key, after all.

36.text: Family or not, the master will be obeyed! You will not open that door.

43.speaker: Godey
43.text: Family or not, the master will be obeyed! You will not open that door.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: But master called me home! I have to get to him!

62.text: After all these years, you still think you can lie to me? Shame on you.

9.speaker: Godey
9.text: After all these years, you still think you can lie to me? Shame on you.

31.speaker: Godey
31.text: It seems I need to put you in your place one last time. Then you're the master's.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: The ballroom door's locked and I need the key.
47.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

40.speaker: Godey
40.text: The doors are locked for a reason - master ordered it so. Master ordered they not be opened, so locked they shall remain.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: I'm looking for Cazador. Where is he?
14.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

29.speaker: Godey
29.text: You're too late, the master entered the ballroom and ordered the doors be sealed behind him. They are not to be opened until his business is done.
29.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

5.speaker: Godey
5.text: Godey will not disobey the master, much less for someone like you.
5.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: He needs me to complete the ritual. He'll be furious if you stop me from joining him.
1.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

71.speaker: Godey
71.text: Godey was wondering about that... Godey knows the master was searching for Astarion. He must have forgotten Astarion was lost.
71.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

32.speaker: Godey
32.text: Godey was wondering about that... Godey knows the master was searching for Astarion. He must have forgotten Astarion was lost.
32.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

23.speaker: Godey
23.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

12.speaker: Godey
12.text: Take it and go. Impudent little brat.
12.context: NodeContext: Last line under his breath

37.speaker: Godey
37.text: Now go to him. Help him achieve his destiny.

70.speaker: Godey
70.text: Here, here it - no... where is it?

69.speaker: Godey
69.text: No no, master will be furious if it is lost. Godey must find it.

19.text: The master will not be disobeyed! You will not open that door.

49.speaker: Godey
49.text: The master will not be disobeyed! You will not open that door.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: But master called me home! I have to get to him!

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: How about I start breaking bones and keep going until I find that key?

74.speaker: Godey
74.text: Wait! Godey has the key. Godey can give it to you.

60.speaker: Godey
60.text: Wait! Godey has the key. Godey can give it to you.

16.text: Oh no. No no no, Godey is not worried by your threats. Godey knows just how to break you.

13.speaker: Godey
13.text: Oh no. No no no, Godey is not worried by your threats. Godey knows just how to break you.

35.speaker: Godey
35.text: Come little one, let's hear that scream of yours one more time.

76.speaker: Godey
76.text: Oh yes, fight Godey. Spill your blood on his kennel's floor.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: I do want to hurt you, if that's what you mean.

34.speaker: Godey
34.text: Hah! You think you can hurt Godey? Oh no, you have been away for too long.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Isn't it obvious? I'm here to kill Cazador.

38.speaker: Godey
38.text: How dare you! As if you could lay a finger on the master, you ungrateful little brat!

41.speaker: Godey
41.text: Godey will not let you get away with blasphemy. Godey will see you punished!

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: I know you're there, Godey. Stop skulking and show yourself.

50.speaker: Godey
50.text: You always were sharp, little one. Sharp enough to cut yourself.
